# GitHub Repository Setup Guide

After pushing to GitHub, configure these settings for best presentation:

## 1. About Section (Settings → General)

**Description:**
```
A 60-day community experiment in open source project funding. Submit your GitHub project, get community attention, and maybe results. No guarantees.
```

**Website:**
```
https://vibe.lucas-futures.com
```

**Topics (Tags):**
```
open-source, community, scrum, kanban, github-projects, crowdfunding, developer-tools, react, typescript, supabase
```

## 2. Social Preview Image

Upload a social preview image (1280x640px recommended) in:
Settings → General → Social preview

## 3. Features to Enable

- [x] Issues (for bug reports and questions)
- [x] Sponsorships (links to website)
- [ ] Wiki (not needed)
- [ ] Projects (not needed)
- [ ] Discussions (optional - can enable later)

## 4. Branch Protection (Optional)

Settings → Branches → Add rule for `main`:
- Require pull request reviews

## 5. Issue Labels

Create these labels for better organization:
- `bug` - Something isn't working (red)
- `enhancement` - New feature or request (blue)
- `question` - Further information is requested (purple)
- `wontfix` - This will not be worked on (white)
- `duplicate` - This issue already exists (gray)

---

This file is for maintainer reference only and won't appear on the main README.
